channel.title: Faroe Islands on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Faroe Islands on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Faroe Islands Football Association Logo The Faroe Islands Football Association, or FSF, is the governing body of all domestic football in the Faroe Islands, the highest level of which is the Faroe Islands Premier League. It also runs the Faroe Islands national teams for men and women. Established in 1979, it is based in Tórshavn. Source
You can download theFaroe Islands Football Associationlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Faroe Islands Football Association
item.description: The Faroe Islands Football Association, or FSF, is the governing body of all domestic football in the Faroe Islands, the highest level of which is the Faroe Islands Premier League. It also runs the Faroe Islands national teams for men and women. Established in 1979, it is based in Tórshavn. Source

07 Vestur Logo 07 Vestur is a Faroese football club, which was founded in 2007. It is located in Sandavágur and Sørvágur on Vágar island. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Argja Bóltfelag Logo
Argja Bóltfelag is a Semi-Professional Faroese football club based in Argir. They were playing their 2020 third season in the Faroe Islands Premier League, after being promoted from 1. deild after playing there for 1 season in 2017. After the 2020 season the ended as 9th and played a match against B68 Toftir from 1. deild, the winner would play in the Faroe Islands Premier League for the 2021 season.
You can download theArgja Boltfelaglogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Argja Boltfelag
item.description: Argja Bóltfelag is a Semi-Professional Faroese football club based in Argir. They were playing their 2020 third season in the Faroe Islands Premier League, after being promoted from 1. deild after playing there for 1 season in 2017. After the 2020 season the ended as 9th and played a match against B68 Toftir from 1. deild, the winner would play in the Faroe Islands Premier League for the 2021 season.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 B36 Tórshavn Logo
B36 Tórshavn is a Faroese semi professional football club based in the capital of Tórshavn, playing in the Faroe Islands Premier League, the top tier of Faroese football. B36 Tórshavn has always played its home games in Gundadalur. Originally all Faroese football teams played on gravel grounds, but starting in the late 1980s the grounds were changed into second generation artificial turf. All the artificial pitches have been changed into third generation artificial turf, approved by FIFA.
You can download theB36 Torshavnlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: B36 Torshavn
item.description: B36 Tórshavn is a Faroese semi professional football club based in the capital of Tórshavn, playing in the Faroe Islands Premier League, the top tier of Faroese football. B36 Tórshavn has always played its home games in Gundadalur. Originally all Faroese football teams played on gravel grounds, but starting in the late 1980s the grounds were changed into second generation artificial turf. All the artificial pitches have been changed into third generation artificial turf, approved by FIFA.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Havnar Bóltfelag Logo
Havnar Bóltfelag is a Faroese football club. It is one of the oldest and most successful football clubs in the Faroe Islands. The club was founded in 1904, and is based in the capital, Tórshavn. Home matches are played at the Gundadalur and they compete in the Faroe Islands Premier League. Havnar Bóltfelag is Faroese for Harbour Football Club, with Havn coming from the name of the town of Tórshavn.
You can download theHavnar Boltfelaglogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Havnar Boltfelag
item.description: Havnar Bóltfelag is a Faroese football club. It is one of the oldest and most successful football clubs in the Faroe Islands. The club was founded in 1904, and is based in the capital, Tórshavn. Home matches are played at the Gundadalur and they compete in the Faroe Islands Premier League. Havnar Bóltfelag is Faroese for Harbour Football Club, with Havn coming from the name of the town of Tórshavn.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Ítróttarfelag Fuglafjarðar Logo Ítróttarfelag Fuglafjarðar, abbreviated to ÍF, is a Faroese football club based in Fuglafjørður. They play their home games at Í Fløtugerði. The 1979 Faroe Islands Premier League title is ÍF’s sole to date. They also won the 1. deild 4 times. Source
You can download theItrottarfelag Fuglafjardarlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Itrottarfelag Fuglafjardar
item.description: Ítróttarfelag Fuglafjarðar, abbreviated to ÍF, is a Faroese football club based in Fuglafjørður. They play their home games at Í Fløtugerði. The 1979 Faroe Islands Premier League title is ÍF’s sole to date. They also won the 1. deild 4 times. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Klaksvíkar Ítróttarfelag Logo Klaksvíkar Ítróttarfelag, commonly known as KÍ, is a Faroese professional football club based in Klaksvík. The club was founded in 1904 and is one of the most successful Faroese football clubs, having won the Faroe Islands Premier League 18 times and the Faroe Islands Cup 6 times. The club wears blue and white and plays matches at the Við Djúpumýrar stadium. Source
You can download theKlaksvikar Itrottarfelaglogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Klaksvikar Itrottarfelag
item.description: Klaksvíkar Ítróttarfelag, commonly known as KÍ, is a Faroese professional football club based in Klaksvík. The club was founded in 1904 and is one of the most successful Faroese football clubs, having won the Faroe Islands Premier League 18 times and the Faroe Islands Cup 6 times. The club wears blue and white and plays matches at the Við Djúpumýrar stadium. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 LÍF Leirvík Logo
Leirvíkar Ítróttarfelag, commonly known as LÍF or LÍF Leirvík, was a Faroese football club based in Leirvík. The club was founded in 1928. They merged with GÍ Gøta in 2008 to form Víkingur, in the year of team’s 80th anniversary. From 1982 to 1989, and for one final time in 1993, LÍF played in the country’s top division, with the best finish being 4th place in 1984 and 1985. In 1986, they lost their only ever Faroe Islands Cup final by 2-1 to NSÍ Runavík.
You can download theLIF Leirviklogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: LIF Leirvik
item.description: Leirvíkar Ítróttarfelag, commonly known as LÍF or LÍF Leirvík, was a Faroese football club based in Leirvík. The club was founded in 1928. They merged with GÍ Gøta in 2008 to form Víkingur, in the year of team’s 80th anniversary. From 1982 to 1989, and for one final time in 1993, LÍF played in the country’s top division, with the best finish being 4th place in 1984 and 1985. In 1986, they lost their only ever Faroe Islands Cup final by 2-1 to NSÍ Runavík.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Royn Hvalba Logo
Royn Hvalba or Bóltfelagið Royn, or just Royn, is a Faroese football and sports association from Hvalba in Suðuroy, founded on 23 October 1923. The chairman for Royn Hvalba is Poul Laust Christiansen. Manager is Brynjar Poulsen. Royn has a team in the Faroese second division. Royn also has teams for girls and boys, in 2012 they had a team for girls under 12, a team for boys U8 and one for boys U10.
You can download theRoyn Hvalbalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Royn Hvalba
item.description: Royn Hvalba or Bóltfelagið Royn, or just Royn, is a Faroese football and sports association from Hvalba in Suðuroy, founded on 23 October 1923. The chairman for Royn Hvalba is Poul Laust Christiansen. Manager is Brynjar Poulsen. Royn has a team in the Faroese second division. Royn also has teams for girls and boys, in 2012 they had a team for girls under 12, a team for boys U8 and one for boys U10.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Víkingur Gøta Logo
Víkingur is a semi-professional football club in the Faroe Islands. The club was founded in 2008 after the merger of GÍ Gøta and Leirvík ÍF. The club is based in Leirvík, while the stadium is in Norðragøta. Both villages are part of the same municipality Eysturkommuna, located on the island of Eysturoy and about 5 kilometers away from each other. The club won the Faroese championship for the first time in the 2016 season.
You can download theVikingur Gotalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Vikingur Gota
item.description: Víkingur is a semi-professional football club in the Faroe Islands. The club was founded in 2008 after the merger of GÍ Gøta and Leirvík ÍF. The club is based in Leirvík, while the stadium is in Norðragøta. Both villages are part of the same municipality Eysturkommuna, located on the island of Eysturoy and about 5 kilometers away from each other. The club won the Faroese championship for the first time in the 2016 season.
